title: Tripadvisor to cut 20% of staff amid internal restructuring
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Tripadvisor plans to cut 20% of its workforce as it merges operations with Viator and focuses on AI integration.
The restructuring includes an $85 million cost-savings program to be completed by 2027, affecting global employees.
Tripadvisor reported a 3% revenue decrease, while Viator and TheFork saw 9% and 28% growth respectively in Q3.

title: An abandoned tent has spurred a hiking mystery in New Hampshire
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: A deserted tent was found at Valley Way in New Hampshire's White Mountains, with no reports of missing hikers.
Search efforts revealed a set of car keys and an Apple AirTag, but no matching vehicle found at nearby trailheads.
Social media posts sought the tent owner's identity, generating speculation, but no credible leads have emerged.

title: Local obituary: Susan Hurley, 62, former Patriots cheerleader who founded CharityTeams
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Susan Hurley, 62, former Patriots cheerleader, founded CharityTeams in 2008, raising $42 million for nonprofits through athletic events.
She was the wife of Boston Marathon Race Director David McGillivray; they raised two sons in North Andover, Massachusetts.
Susan was diagnosed with ovarian cancer in 2022; she is remembered for her philanthropy and a vibrant personality.

title: Market Basket launches its own beer — here’s where to buy it
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Market Basket launched a 'More For Your Dollar' lager in collaboration with Vermont's Zero Gravity Beer.
The 12-pack of the lager costs $12.99 and is sold at MB Spirits and Market Basket locations in Massachusetts, Maine, and New Hampshire.
The beer launch follows the recent ousting of Market Basket's CEO Arthur T. Demoulas.

title: As SJC mulls involvement in public defender work stoppage, here’s where things stand
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Massachusetts public defenders began a work stoppage in May, demanding a pay raise; 900 defendants remain without representation.
The Supreme Judicial Court heard arguments about whether judges can temporarily increase pay rates for court-appointed attorneys.
A law passed in August increased pay for defense attorneys by 30%, but the issue of unrepresented defendants persists.

title: Reese Witherspoon visits Boston bookstore
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Reese Witherspoon visited Beacon Hill Books and Cafe in Boston to sign copies of her debut novel 'Gone Before Goodbye.'
Witherspoon attended a private dinner and gave a talk at Harvard Business School during her visit to Boston.
Her debut novel, co-authored with Harlan Coben, became an instant New York Times bestseller.

title: GOP lawmakers pushing Healey for info on aide arrested in cocaine bust
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: GOP lawmakers demand transparency from Gov. Maura Healey after LaMar Cook's cocaine trafficking arrest and termination.
Healey faces scrutiny about Cook's 2023 hiring despite his past legal issues, prompting calls to review vetting processes.
Cook's arrest becomes political leverage in 2026 gubernatorial race, with GOP candidates criticizing Healey's administration.

title: 2 teens killed in New Bedford crash identified
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Two teens killed in a New Bedford crash were identified as Gabriel Bertolino Siqueira, 17, and Anne Urbanski Santos De Carvalho, 15.
The crash involved a single-car accident on Route 140 South around 2 a.m., involving a 2019 Honda Civic.
The driver, an 18-year-old man from Dartmouth, sustained non-life-threatening injuries; the investigation is ongoing.

title: BPD releases multiple photos of baseball-capped commercial burglary suspect
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Boston police seek public help to identify a suspect involved in downtown commercial burglaries since August 21.
The suspect reportedly uses a pry tool for access, stealing credit cards, cash, and electronics from multiple locations.
Break-ins also reported by Boston University, Cambridge, and Northeastern University police; contact 617-343-4571 with info.

title: Report: Mike Vrabel’s former team was ‘unwilling’ to trade with Patriots
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Titans reportedly avoided trade with Patriots due to lingering resentment over Mike Vrabel's firing.
Titans owner Amy Adams Strunk remains displeased with Vrabel's exit, influencing trade decisions.
Patriots were interested in Titans running back at trade deadline, but no deal was made.
